summary: Educational mobile app "SkillSwap" for learning and teaching skills via short video lessons, with Google (Gmail) sign-in and a learning-credit system.
architectural_notes: Use Google OAuth for authentication (Gmail sign-in).
Maintain a credit ledger/balance per user; initialize to 100 credits on account creation and decrement on lesson consumption.
Set lesson video upload validation/limits to allow up to 100 MB per video.

existing_features.title: Implement user authentication using Internet Identity (II) and create a user profile on first successful sign-in. Because direct Gmail/Google OAuth is not supported, provide a profile field where a user may optionally enter a Gmail address for display/contact (not for authentication).

Add a learning-credits system: initialize each new user with 100 learning credits; deduct a defined small number of credits when a user watches/completes a lesson; prevent credits from going below zero and block lesson completion if insufficient credits.
Create lesson entities for short video lessons and implement browsing and playback: users can view a list of lessons, open a lesson detail view, and play the video in-app.
Enable users to upload short videos to teach skills by creating new lessons with attached video content, including basic validation and size limits suitable for canister storage.
Apply a coherent, distinct visual theme for SkillSwap across the app (layout, typography, and color system) suitable for a mobile-first experience; avoid blue/purple as the primary palette.
Add generated static brand assets and render them in the UI (app icon and wordmark/logo) from frontend/public/assets/generated (do not serve generated images via the backend).

Increase the maximum allowed lesson video upload size to 100 MB in the frontend validation and file-reading utilities, and update all user-facing helper/validation text on the Upload Lesson page to reflect the new 100 MB limit.

new_feature_requests.summary: Add learning credits system: start each user with 100 credits and deduct a small number per lesson watched
Enable users to watch short video lessons to learn skills
Enable users to upload short videos to teach skills
Increase maximum allowed uploaded lesson video size to 100 MB
Increase the backend createLesson video size validation limit from 10 MB to 100 MB so that uploads accepted by the frontend are also accepted by the canister.
